content.rendered:
Looking to kickstart your social media in 2021?

After a very unusual 2020, we can all breathe a sigh of relief that 2021 is nearly here!

Sure 2020 has been a write off, but we’re starting fresh! And what better way to get a head start on your 2021 social media strategy than with the Harrison Carloss marketing calendar – jam packed with all of the events (hopefully!) happening in the UK next year, including quite a few that have been rescheduled from 2020.

Start thinking of exciting and creative ways to celebrate 2021, and create a basis for your marketing and social media strategy for the year!

January

All Month – Dry January

All Month – Veganuary

1st January – New Year’s Day

18th January – Blue Monday

25th January – Burn’s Night

 

February

6th February – Six Nations Begins

12th February – Chinese New Year

14th February – Valentine’s Day

16th February – Shrove Tuesday/Pancake Day

17th February – Ash Wednesday

 

March

1st March – St David’s Day

8th March – International Women’s Day

14th March – Mother’s Day

17th March – St Patrick’s Day

20th March – First Day of Spring

28th March – Clocks Go Forward

 

April

1st April – April Fool’s Day

2nd April – Good Friday

4rd April – Easter Sunday

5th April – Easter Monday

22nd April – Earth Day

23rd April – St. George’s Day

 

May

3rd May – Bank Holiday

4th May – Star Wars Day

31st May – Bank Holiday

 

June

4th to 6th June – Download Festival

12th June – UEFA Euro Start

15th June – National Beer Day

20th June – Father’s Day

21st June – Summer Solstice/Longest Day

23rd to 27th June – Glastonbury Festival

28th June – Wimbledon Starts

 

July

11th July – Wimbledon Final

12th July – UEFA Euro Final

23rd July – Tokyo Olympics Opening Ceremony

 

August

6th August – Beer Day

8th August – Tokyo Olympics Closing Ceremony

24th August – Tokyo Paralympics Opening Ceremony

29th to 30th August – Notting Hill Carnival

30th August – Bank Holiday

 

September

5th September – Tokyo Paralympics Closing Ceremony

 

October

All Month – Sober October

All Month – Black History Month

10th October – World Mental Health Day

31st October – Clocks Go Back

31st October – Halloween

 

November

All Month – Movember

5th – Bonfire Night

11th November – Remembrance Day

14th November – Remembrance Sunday

26th November – Black Friday

27th November – Small Business Saturday

29th November – Cyber Monday

30th November – St Andrew’s Day

 

December

14th December – Christmas Jumper Day

21st December – Winter Solstice/Shortest Day

24th December – Christmas Eve

25th December – Christmas Day

26th December – Boxing Day

31st December – New Year’s Eve

 

So that’s the lot! Hopefully we haven’t jinxed it…

If you need expert support with your 2021 marketing strategy, find out more about what services we offer, including Creative, Print and more!
